intro: Erigeron platylepis, commonly known as the broad-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are broadly ovate to lance-shaped, with a hairy texture, and its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron platylepis is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
